sub_title: Knowledge Management | Library & Information Management | Communications
summary:
Senior specialist in knowledge management, library & information management, and communications, with two decades of professional experience: passionate, self-motivated, innovative, methodical, and results-oriented.

👩🏻‍💻 Librarian and advocate for libraries and access to information for sustainable development.

♀️Feminist and advocate for women's rights and gender equity.

#Lib4Dev #DA2I #KM4Dev #Fin4Dev #Tech4Dev #GlobalGoals #EmbraceEquity

projects.title: “Disclosure and Transparency” Initiative
projects.description: Lead the implementation of FMO’s Disclosure and Transparency Initiative concerning a full review of the Customer Disclosure Policy, as well as all underlying processes, procedures, templates, systems, and socialization of reforms internally and externally. As the contact person for the initiate, I oversaw all aspects of implementation including decision making, planning, budget, cross-departmental coordination, communications, and reporting.

Issue Management Officer at FMO - Dutch entrepreneurial development bank

projects.title: “Improving knowledge findability via Microsoft Search” KM Solution
projects.description:
Lead a foundational KM solution to (in 4 months) enhance knowledge findability at FMO by making low-cost/high impact improvements to increase the Microsoft Search maturity level using out-of-the-box components. Customize the Microsoft Search using acronyms, bookmarks, Q&As, verticals, locations, and connectors to provide seamless access to key knowledge assets through an integrated search:
- Nearly four hundred acronyms/abbreviations used across the organization
- More than six hundred definitions from the business glossary (Axon)
- More than 1800 processes and activities from the Process Atlas (Mavim)
- More than one hundred curated bookmarks (SharePoint)
- Policies, templates, and information hubs (SharePoint)
- Content published in the FMO website

contributors.headline: Knowledge Management | Library & Information Management | Communications
ICT Manager Microsoft Applications at FMO Bank
Knowledge Management Officer at FMO | Development Economist - International Institue of Social Studies

projects.title: “Learning from Action” KM Solution
projects.description:
Introduce, design, and lead the “Learning from Action” KM Solution to help FMO become a learning organization, by leveraging the lessons gained from experience and (re)using them to improve future practice. Perform an internal exploration, benchmarking, and offer high level recommendations with a long-term perspective. Offer toolkits, templates, awareness sessions and guidance. Capture, share, and help improve existing learning from action initiatives. 

Propose "After Action Reviews" (as well as Before Action Reviews and Mid-Action Reviews) as a standard methodology for learning from action (in combination with Root Cause Analysis and Evaluations), combining the strengths of Evaluations and Knowledge Management, and developing a custom methodology, toolkits, governance, and templates based on international good practices.

contributors.headline: Knowledge Management | Library & Information Management | Communications
Economist focused on social impact & ESG

projects.title: “Expertise Locator” KM Quick Win
projects.description: Lead and designed the KM Quick Win through which FMO created a GDPR compliant “expertise locator" by enriching the employee directory with two new custom fields “Roles and memberships” and “Team”, to be displayed in user profiles and searched via the “People” vertical in Microsoft search. This development reuses and (slightly) customizes Microsoft 365 user profiles, by connecting a SharePoint lists, Power Automate flows, scheduled updates via scripts, and a roster taxonomy in the term store management tool to develop a simple and easy to use interface which takes advantage of existing information and roles/responsibilities.

authors.headline: Knowledge Management | Library & Information Management | Communications

profile_positions.description:
Contribute to the FMO strategy by enhancing FMO as a knowledge and learning organization:
- Contribute to set up a Knowledge Management function at FMO and help design and implement a KM Roadmap and Implementation Plan.
- Design, lead and support KM quick wins and solutions, that realize results by developing new Knowledge Management processes, platforms and tools to optimize the flow of knowledge internally and externally, effectively connect people to information, and people to people. 
- Drive communications and change management efforts related to KM, developing communications strategies, scheduling and content.
- Provide expert advice to FMO on topics related to Knowledge Management, Information and Content Management, Document Management, Collaboration, Knowledge Dissemination, Knowledge Sharing, Digital Events and Communications.
- Liaise and collaborate with colleagues and other departments as well as a network of Knowledge Champions to design and implement KM quick wins and solutions.
profile_positions.title: Knowledge Management Officer

company.name: International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions (IFLA)

profile_positions.company: International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions (IFLA)
profile_positions.description:
-Develop and maintain a communications content calendar for IFLA to ensure more efficient management of IFLA's digital presence, taking full advantage of the content generated by all its areas.
-Plan and implement IFLA's digital events, including the series of IFLA Webinars on YouTube and the live streaming offer of the President's Meeting and the IFLA's World Library and Information Congress (IFLA WLIC). Organise, script, produce and implement IFLA WLIC's General Assemblies and Closing Sessions.
-Manage communications of the "International Advocacy Programme" (IAP) and IFLA's work related to promote the role libraries play in achieving the 2030 Agenda and the SDGs. Provide tools and support to members to implement campaigns and advocacy activities. Advocate at a global level. Co-organise 6 regional workshops in Singapore, Montevideo, Pretoria, The Hague, Doha, and Montego Bay, as well as a Global Convening in New York.
-Manage the communications of the "Development and Access to Information" (DA2I) Report, a series of reports that monitors the progress countries are making towards fulfilling their commitment to promoting meaningful access to information as part of the SDGs. Create the communications plan and strategy, communication pieces, social media, website, supporting materials, webinars in 3 languages and presentations. Manage the publication process, co-organise the launch and side-events in New York, Buenos Aires and Santiago de Chile, and promote the report worldwide.
-Support and provide communications advice to the Policy & Advocacy team to connect IFLA’s advocacy work more closely with its membership and advice IFLA representatives undertaking advocacy.
-Contribute to the communications of the Library Map of the World and the WLIC, managing social media, plan communications strategies, creating content, etc.
-Contribute to the development of the new IFLA website (planning, research, requirements, navigation, taxonomies, and preparing concept papers)
profile_positions.title: Communications Officer

profile_positions.title: Advocacy Communications Officer

company.name: Felipe Herrera Library, Knowledge and Learning Sector (KNL/FHL)

profile_positions.description:
−Offer Library's products and services to anticipate the needs of the Institutions for Development Sector (IFD). Support the dissemination of IFD publications and data though the Bank's Repository of Institutional Knowledge (BRIK) and Numbers for Development (N4D), the IDB Open Data Portal. 
−Data management: Promote the publication of IFD data products in N4D.  Provide advice on data publishing best practices, support on data formatting, metadata, and IDB authorizations process. 
−Data visualization: Create visualizations of public datasets, to improve the dissemination and use of datasets by a wider audience. 
−Publications management: As IFD Gatekeeper, support IFD clients and Departmental Reviewer in issues regarding the IDB Publications Manual. Advise the BRIK team in metadata issues. Follow up with IFD clients to promote the publication of their knowledge products (KPs). Training on cataloging and indexing of junior consultants, and quality control. Cataloging in Publication for IDB Publications. 
−Discovery and dissemination: Creation of Google Scholar profiles. Support the development of the Bank's Taxonomy. Regular highlight of IFD data and publications in the website banners. 
−Specialized sectorial services: Engagement of IFD clients with library products and services. Production and update of Infoguides and perform research on new quality information resources for regular E-mail updates delivery on the topics of the work of IFD. 
−Reference services: interlibrary loans, purchase requests, and article delivery. Training on how to access information products, and data and publications management. Library Apps installations. 
−Support in ensuring quality information delivery, metadata, and data management best practices by updating library guidelines and procedures gathered in the Reference Services Infoguide, BRIK Cataloguing Guidelines Infoguide, MyData Infoguide and MyPublications Intranet site.
profile_positions.title: Knowledge and Learning Consultant (IFD Embedded Librarian)

profile_positions.description:
−Production/update of Infoguides to anticipate the information needs of the Institutions for Development Sector (IFD) clients.
−Performed research on information resources for E-mail update delivery to IFD groups.
−Offered general reference services to FHL clients.
−Offered training to IDB employees regarding data and publications. 
−Supported activities relating to maintenance and growth of the Bank's Repository of Institutional Knowledge (BRIK), and training of junior technical consultants.
−Support in ensuring quality metadata and information delivery by updating the Reference Services Infoguide and the BRIK Cataloguing Guidelines Infoguide.
profile_positions.title: Knowledge and Learning Consultant (IFD Dissemination Librarian)

profile_positions.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
profile_positions.description:
−Surveyed knowledge products from 79 PRODEV (Program to Implement the External Pillar of the Medium Term Action Plan for Development Effectiveness) Technical Cooperations (TCs), based on the documentation of these TCs available in the Bank's systems.
−Collection and inventory of over 700 knowledge products by searching IDBDocs, and meeting/interviewing TC’s team leaders, executing units and records managers in Country Offices and Headquarters.
−Organization of the selection process of Knowledge Products by the PRODEV team to be incorporated in the Bank's Repository of Institutional Knowledge (BRIK). Definition of specific metadata and cataloguing guidelines for this collection according to the FHL practices. Supervision and quality control of cataloguing/indexing of more than 500 knowledge products.
profile_positions.title: Knowledge Management Consultant

profile_positions.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
profile_positions.description:
−Support the Bank's Repository of Institutional Knowledge (BRIK) Team in activities related to the maintenance and growth of BRIK by ingesting, updating, and merging records.
−Support the IDB Cataloger and Taxonomist in cataloging and classifying bibliographic materials using Aleph, Library of Congress Subject Headings (LCSH), Library of Congress Classification (LCC), and Online Computer Library Center (OCLC).
−Supported the development of IDB’s taxonomy, using Semaphore Ontology Manager.
−Support the Liaison Librarian on Integration and Trade (INT) by creating Infoguides.
−Support the Communications and Marketing Librarian on the “Mobile FHL” campaign.
−Organization of IDB print publications repository.
profile_positions.title: Knowledge and Learning Winter Intern (mid-career)

company.name: Instituto de Formacion Tecnica Superior No. 13 (Gobierno de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires)

profile_positions.location: Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
profile_positions.description:
−Training in cataloging and classification of more than 60 students per academic year.
−Update of the program, schedule and curriculum according to current requirements and necessary tools for cataloging of non-book materials, indexing and classification in libraries.
profile_positions.title: Cataloging and Classification Teacher, Tecnicatura Superior en Bibliotecología

company.name: Centro de Economía Internacional, Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y Culto

profile_positions.location: Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
profile_positions.company: Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, Comercio Internacional y Culto de la República Argentina
profile_positions.description:
−Management of the Center for International Economics (CEI) Library and World Trade Organization (WTO) Reference Centre in Argentina, working as librarian for a team of economists, econometricians, political science specialists and translators.
−Inauguration of the WTO Reference Centre in Argentina within the CEI Library in July 2010.
−Design of the interface layout and retrieval system of library catalogues for monographs and articles, serials, and CEI’s publications through a joint work with the Information Technology Area of the Ministry. Webmaster and design of sections, contents, and taxonomy for CEI's new website for disseminating publications and data generated by CEI.
−Answer to specialized users' enquiries, elaboration of specialized bibliographies and bibliographic searches. Reference services, such as interlibrary loans and article delivery. Answer to statistical requests, extracting data from ARGEXIM, CEI's unique foreign trade database, with the economic specialists' verification.
−Management of CEI's internal communications, of institutional e-mail account, and of distribution mailing list for the dissemination of CEI publications. ISBN, ISSN, and intellectual property registration. Maintenance and update of CEI’s publications and internal reports repository, and distribution of CEI publications in the Buenos Aires International Book Fair.
−Cataloging and indexing of bibliographic material (OECD's Macrothesaurus and ITC's Thesaurus of International Trade Terms).
−Requests for donations and arrangement of more than 80 exchange agreements. Acquisitions and subscriptions.
−Complete organization of the moving of the library to new offices in September 2012.
profile_positions.title: Head Librarian at CEI Library and WTO Reference Centre in Argentina

profile_positions.location: Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
profile_positions.description:
−Cataloguing of the complete collection and creation of the procedures manual for cataloging and indexing.
−Collection development through arrangement of exchange agreements.
−Offered reference and bibliographic services.
profile_positions.title: Library & Media Library Intern

profile_positions.location: San Martín, Provincia de Buenos Aires
profile_positions.description:
−Update of serials and monographs catalogs, and KARDEX. Finished retrospective cataloguing task of monographic resources. The library was able to discard the print card catalog after my internship.
−Offered reference services and bibliographic searches.
profile_positions.title: Library Intern
